meanings.definition: The act of covering or dusting with flour.
meanings.sent1: After the bread dough rose, the baker did a light flouring on the surface.
meanings.sent2: She did a quick flouring of the cutting board before rolling out the pastry.
meanings.sent3: The flouring of the cake pan turned into a cloud of white powder in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The flouring of the chicken wings made them look like they were wearing snowy coats.
meanings.sent5: The flouring of the cookies made them look like little snow-covered treats.

meanings.definition: The process of making something into flour.
meanings.sent1: The flouring of wheat involves grinding it into a fine powder.
meanings.sent2: The flouring of corn requires a special mill to turn it into flour.
meanings.sent3: The ancient method of flouring grains involved using a stone grinder.
meanings.sent4: The flouring of rice transforms it from grains into a versatile ingredient.
meanings.sent5: The flouring of barley results in a smooth and powdery substance.

meanings.definition: The act of using flour in cooking or baking.
meanings.sent1: Her secret to perfect pancakes was the flouring she did before mixing the batter.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a generous flouring of the work surface to prevent sticking.
meanings.sent3: The flouring of the dough made it easier to handle and shape into loaves.
meanings.sent4: The flouring of the pie crust gave it a golden and crispy finish.
meanings.sent5: The flouring of the muffin tin ensured the muffins would release easily after baking.
